Admission to CREST

Students must be referred to CREST by their local school district prior to consideration for enrollment in CREST. Although parents may attend a general tour of the program, tours specific to the student are not scheduled without prior approval/communication with the school district. A current IEP and most recent evaluations will be reviewed by CREST staff to determine if goals and objectives can be addressed by CREST’s educational program and therapies. Parents and the potential student are asked to meet with administrative staff, tour the program, and ask and answer questions. Following this sharing of information and tour, CREST meets internally to determine if the program can meet the IEP and defined needs of the prospective student. Both district and parents are contacted as to the determination of the “staffing”. An individual service agreement is prepared by the referring school district, setting forth the specific terms and conditions as established when the student is admitted.  For more information on beginning the referral process, please contact the CREST Administrative Office.

CREST Education Center, Inc. admits students of any race, color, national origin, and ethnic origin to its’ program with all the rights, privileges, programs, and activities generally accorded or made available to every student at the school.  CREST Education Center, Inc. does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, and ethnic origin in administration of its educational policies, scholarship and loan programs (if any), and athletic and other school-administered programs.
